Jenazah TKW yang Meninggal di Malaysia Tiba di Makassar
01 Nov 2019, 00:17 by Muhammad Nur Abdurrahman
Makassar -
Jenazah Tenaga Kerja Wanita (TKW), Nurjannah (36), yang bekerja di Serawak, Malaysia, tiba di kampung halamannya, Makassar.
Peti jenazah Nurjannah diangkut kargo pesawat Lion Air, rute Pontianak-Makassar, tiba di Bandara Sultan Hasanuddin, sekitar pukul 23.30 Wita, Kamis (31/10/2019). Jenazah langsung diantar ke rumah duka, di Jalan Butta-Butta Caddi, Kelurahan Kalukubodoa, Kecamatan Tallo.
Isak tangis ibunda almarhumah Nurhalija menyambut peti jenazah Nurjannah. Kerabat dan tetangga Nurjannah juga ikut menyambut kedatangan jenazah.
Menurut Yusuf, suami Nurjannah, istrinya meninggal tidak lama setelah melahirkan di rumah sakit Sibu, Serawak. Istrinya sempat dirawat di rumah sakit di Kota Sibu, negara bagian Serawak, sebelum meninggal dunia pada 18 Oktober.
"Kami kerja petik buah (sawit) di Daro Jaya, saat dia mengandung, dia tidak boleh bekerja," ujar Yusuf singkat.
Jenazah Nurjannah sempat disimpan selama 13 hari di kamar jenazah rumah sakit Sibu. Yusuf akhirnya bisa menjemput jasad istrinya dan membawa pulang ke Makassar, setelah mendapat bantuan dana dari salah seorang dermawan di Kota Makassar.
Almarhumah Nurjannah meninggalkan dua anak, salah satunya bayi yang berusia sekitar 1 bulan yang baru dilahirkannya. Rencananya jenazah Nurjannah akan dimakamkan di taman pekuburan Islam Beroanging, Makassar, Jumat (1/11).

(mna/fdn)

The bodies of TKW who died in Malaysia arrived in Makassar
Nov 01 2019, 00:17 by Muhammad Nur Abdurrahman
Makassar -
The body of the Female Worker (TKW), Nurjannah (36), who worked in Sarawak, Malaysia, arrived at her hometown, Makassar.
Nurjannah's coffin was transported by Lion Air cargo plane, Pontianak-Makassar route, arrived at Sultan Hasanuddin Airport, around 23.30 Wita, Thursday (10/31/2019). The body was immediately escorted to the funeral home, on Jalan Butta-Butta Caddi, Kalukubodoa Village, Tallo District.
Sobs of the late Nurhalija's mother welcomed Nurjannah's coffin. Nurjannah's relatives and neighbors also welcomed the body.
According to Yusuf, Nurjannah's husband, his wife died not long after giving birth at the Sibu hospital, Sarawak. His wife was treated at a hospital in Sibu City, Sarawak state, before dying on October 18.
"We worked picking fruit (palm) in Daro Jaya, when she was pregnant, she was not allowed to work," Yusuf said curtly.
Nurjannah's body was stored for 13 days in the morgue of the Sibu hospital. Joseph was finally able to pick up the body of his wife and bring her home to Makassar, after receiving financial assistance from a philanthropist in the city of Makassar.
The late Nurjannah left two children, one of them a baby who was around 1 month old and had just been born. The plan is that Nurjannah's body will be buried in the Beroanging Islamic cemetery, Makassar, Friday (1/11).

(mna / fdn)
